item.description: Heteroskedasticity ggplot(data = df3,aes(x=Xhat,y=df3[,1])) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method="lm") +ylab("Y")+ ggtitle("Proportional Heteroskedasticity") coefs ## [1] -0.4676886 1.4952495 1.7817561 1.2779524 -2.3276220 Suppose we used a log transformation mod2 <- lm(log(Y) ~ .,data=df3) Xhat2 <- predict.lm(mod2,df3[,2:(p+1)]) ggplot(data = df3,aes(x=Xhat2,y=log(df3[,1]))) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method="lm") +ylab("log(Y)")+ ggtitle("Log Transformation")+xlab("Y-hat") Simulating the Bias of Log Transform N <- 10000 n <- 500 p <- 3 alpha_a <- 0 betas_het <- matrix(nrow = N, ncol = p+1,0) betas_log <- matrix(nrow = N, ncol = p+1,0) marg_effect_log <- vector("list",length = N) coefs <- c(1,2,3) sigmas = runif(p,min=sig_x1,max = sig_x2) P <- qr.
